SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.siemens.icm.io
Class ADC

java.lang.Object
  com.siemens.icm.io.ADC
public class ADC
extends Object

The ADC class provides the ability to get sampled values from the Analogue Digital Converter inputs. Values can either be polled by the midlet or the listener mechanism with an automatic sampling interval from 100 to 30.000 ms. If sampling is enabled the registered listener callbacks will be called with the measured values. These callbacks do not occur faster than every second, instead multiple values are delivered in one callback. Due to heavy system load samples may be discarded!

Example 

   ADC adc = new ADC(0,0);              // adc channel 0 with sampling interval of 0, which disables automatic
                                        // sampling so listeners can not be used  

   for (int i=0;i<100;i++)              // take 100 samples, one every five seconds
   {           
       System.out.println("\r\nSample: " + adc.getValue() + " mV");
 
       Thread.sleep(5000*1);    
   }

See Also:
ADCListener, DAC

Constructor Detail

ADC

public ADC(int channel,
           int interval)
Creates a new instance of the ADC class.

Parameters:
channel - Selects the adc input channel. Valid values are 0 or 1.
interval - Sampling interval in ms with a resolution of 60/13 ms. Valid values are from 100 to 30.000 or 0 for no sampling.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs
See Also:
ADCListener
Method Detail

getValue

public int getValue()
Gets a single sample value.

Returns:
The measured voltage in mV. Range is -25 to 2425.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs

getInterval

public int getInterval()
Gets the current interval.

getChannel

public int getChannel()
Gets the channel.

addListener

public void addListener(ADCListener listener)
Registers listeners to receive sample values. The listener object is an implementation of ADCListener interface. Listeners are stored into an internal HashTable.

Parameters:
listener - The ADCListener object to be registered.
See Also:
ADCListener, removeListener(com.siemens.icm.io.ADCListener)

removeListener

public void removeListener(ADCListener listener)
Removes a listener object which has been previously added to the internal list table of listener objects. After it has been removed from the list it won't be called in case of new sampled values any more. If it hasn't been registered before the list will remain unchanged.

Parameters:
listener - The ADCListener object to be removed from the list.
See Also:
ADCListener, addListener(com.siemens.icm.io.ADCListener)

clearListener

public void clearListener()
Removes all listener objects which have been previously added to the list table of listener objects.

See Also:
ADCListener, addListener(com.siemens.icm.io.ADCListener)

release

public void release()
Stops and removes the listeners and releases all HW resources.

Throws:
IOException - if an error occurs
See Also:
ADC
